attributes.action: Allow GP & NHS patient referrals for muscularskeletal and soft-tissue disorders to qualified, insured professional remedial massage therapists who meet professional training standards, continuing professional development, codes of conduct and practice.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Remedial massage therapy is the manual manipulation of a patients soft-tissue i.e. muscles, tendons, ligaments, nerves, cartilage, fibrous tissue, lymphatic system, skin etc. 

The types of conditions which may be helped with remedial massage therapy include: arthritis, back pain, CTD, fatigue, fibrositis, frozen shoulder, headache, inflammation, microtrauma, migraine, muscular atrophy, muscular cramps, muscular dysfunctions, muscular imbalance, muscular tension, numbness, pain, RSI, runner's knee, scar tissue, shin splints, skeletal dysfunctions, spasms, spondylitis, sprains, stiff neck, strains, tendonitis, tennis elbow, trapped nerves, whiplash, WRULD.

There is strong medical and scientific evidence proving remedial massage therapy can help to cure or alleviate a number of conditions. However, it is still unavailable as a direct referral from the NHS. Please sign this petition if you would like the government to allow GP & NHS patient referrals to professional remedial massage therapists.
